pull.title: wallet: allow zero-fee fundrawtransaction/walletcreatefundedpsbt and other fixes
pull.body:
- Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20305/files#r525406176. A check to raise an error on zero-fee txns was mistakenly extended in a0d4957 from the bumpfee and send{toaddress, many} RPCs to also include fundrawtransaction and walletcreatefundedpsbt. This commit re-overrides zero fee rate checking for these two RPCs, not only for the feeRate (BTC/kvB) arg to return to previous behavior, but also for the new fee_rate (sat/vB) arg. Negative fee rates will still raise "amount out of range" by the MoneyRange check in src/bitcoin-tx.cpp::AmountFromValue.

- Updates a wallet bumpfee test from feeRate (BTC/kvB) to fee_rate (sat/vB)

- Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20305/files#r525405363 to use the correct incremental fee rate constant in the bumpfee help  (thanks Marco Falke for the catch) and rectifies "1.000 sat/vB sat/vB" in the help to "1.000 sat/vB"

issue.title: wallet: introduce fee_rate sat/vB param/option
issue.body:
This PR builds on #11413 and #20220 to address #19543.

- replace overloading the conf_target and estimate_mode params with `fee_rate` in sat/vB in the sendtoaddress, sendmany, send, fundrawtransaction, walletcreatefundedpsbt, and bumpfee RPCs

- allow non-actionable conf_target value of `0` and estimate_mode value of `""` to be passed to use `fee_rate` as a positional argument, in addition to as a named argument

- fix a bug in the experimental send RPC described in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20220#discussion_r513789526 where args were not being passed correctly into the options values

- update the feerate error message units for these RPCs from BTC/kB to sat/vB

- update the test coverage, help docs, doxygen docs, and some of the RPC examples

- other changes to address the excellent review feedback

See this wallet meeting log for more context: http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2020-11-06.html#l-309

events.body:
in commit 3856f0fdc41fa72e8123f5ba64077d62e8163b4f: Could add test for

* 0-fee for `send*` rpcs, and
* negative fee for all rpcs?
I think we already have these tests, added in #20305. Will re-verify.
Found some test coverage improvements to make, thanks @Xekyo and @MarcoFalke. Updated.
Concept ACK and thanks. Will review when ci is green

```
substring: 'Insufficient total fee 0.00000141, must be at least 0.00001704 (oldFee 0.00000999 + incrementalFee 0.00000705)'
error message: 'Insufficient total fee 0.00000141, must be at least 0.00001712 (oldFee 0.00001007 + incrementalFee 0.00000705)'.
```
Restarted the tasks, they pass, and the failure looks unrelated to this changeset. I can push a patch to loosen the test, though, if wanted.

verification.payload:
tree ae59a2d605fb801934bc4d0db0fcea224cf76c59
parent 04670ef81ea2300fcba4e1a492c4c6b0e0752848
author Jon Atack <jon@atack.com> 1605807480 +0100
committer Jon Atack <jon@atack.com> 1605861644 +0100

Allow zero-fee fundrawtxn and walletcreatefundedpsbt calls

A check to raise an error on zero-fee txns was mistakenly extended in commit
a0d4957 from the bumpfee and send{toaddress, many} RPCs to also include
fundrawtransaction and walletcreatefundedpsbt.

This commit overrides zero fee rate checking for these two RPCs, not only for
the feeRate (BTC/kvB) arg to return to previous behavior, but also for the new
fee_rate (sat/vB) arg.

A check to raise an error on zero-fee txns was mistakenly extended in commit
a0d4957 from the bumpfee and send{toaddress, many} RPCs to also include

This commit overrides zero fee rate checking for these two RPCs, not only for

events.message:
Use the correct incremental fee constant in bumpfee help

and remove redundant units ("Must be at least 1.000 sat/vB sat/vB" -> "1.00 sat vB")

events.body:
Latest push:
- addition to first commit: fix a test in rpc_psbt.py
- addition to second commit: loosen two tests in wallet_bumpfee.py that may cause spurious CI failures
- addition to third commit: fix "sat vB sat vB" in the bumpfee help

diff ` git diff a02349d 9f08780`:
```diff
diff --git a/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp b/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp
index a39e8a4e30..dd75e876bc 100644
--- a/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp
+++ b/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp
@@ -3405,7 +3405,7 @@ static RPCHelpMan bumpfee_helper(std::string method_name)
                     {"fee_rate", RPCArg::Type::AMOUNT, /* default */ "not set, fall back to wallet fee estimation",
                              "\nSpecify a fee rate in " + CURRENCY_ATOM + "/vB instead of relying on the built-in fee estimator.\n"
-                             "Must be at least " + incremental_fee + " " + CURRENCY_ATOM + "/vB higher than the current transaction fee rate.\n"
+                             "Must be at least " + incremental_fee + " higher than the current transaction fee rate.\n"
                              "WARNING: before version 0.21, fee_rate was in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kvB. As of 0.21, fee_rate is in " + CURRENCY_ATOM + "/vB.\n"},
diff --git a/test/functional/rpc_psbt.py b/test/functional/rpc_psbt.py
index 0afa9d7835..5840801b00 100755
--- a/test/functional/rpc_psbt.py
+++ b/test/functional/rpc_psbt.py
@@ -201,7 +201,7 @@ class PSBTTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
 
         self.log.info("Test min fee rate checks with walletcreatefundedpsbt are bypassed and that funding non-standard 'zero-fee' transactions is valid")
         for param in ["fee_rate", "feeRate"]:
-            assert_equal(self.nodes[1].walletcreatefundedpsbt(inputs, outputs, 0, {"fee_rate": 0, "add_inputs": True})["fee"], 0)
+            assert_equal(self.nodes[1].walletcreatefundedpsbt(inputs, outputs, 0, {param: 0, "add_inputs": True})["fee"], 0) 
diff --git a/test/functional/wallet_bumpfee.py b/test/functional/wallet_bumpfee.py
index fab3ab1e27..99c9737258 100755
--- a/test/functional/wallet_bumpfee.py
+++ b/test/functional/wallet_bumpfee.py
@@ -107,12 +107,10 @@ class BumpFeeTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
         # Bumping to just above minrelay should fail to increase the total fee enough.
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Insufficient total fee 0.00000141, must be at least 0.00001704 (oldFee 0.00000999 + incrementalFee 0.00000705)",
-            rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid, {"fee_rate": INSUFFICIENT})
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Insufficient total fee 0.00000141", rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid, {"fee_rate": INSUFFICIENT})
 
         self.log.info("Test invalid fee rate settings")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Insufficient total fee 0.00, must be at least 0.00001704 (oldFee 0.00000999 + incrementalFee 0.00000705)",
-            rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid, {"fee_rate": 0})
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Insufficient total fee 0.00", rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid, {"fee_rate": 0})
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Specified or calculated fee 0.141 is too high (cannot be higher than -maxtxfee 0.10",
             rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid, {"fee_rate": TOO_HIGH})
```

issue.title: [backport] wallet: allow zero-fee fundrawtransaction/walletcreatefundedpsbt and other fixes
issue.body:
Github-Pull: #20426
Rebased-From: 1b3d7009280595108eb22ac1188bc4367804fc5d

Github-Pull: #20426
Rebased-From: 3f1e10b2b1cd11f7112fbad6355464bd4adbbc5c

Rebased-From: 9f08780dd7946b63476e9736745131db8e7f4e93

events.body:
Backported to 0.21 by #20510.

`Needs backport (0.21)` tag can be removed.

issue.title: wallet: check for non-representable CFeeRates
issue.body:
As part of our migration to sat/vB feerates that began with #20305, this pull should resolve #20534 and improve/reduce the size of #20391 that adds a `setfeerate` RPC in sat/vB, as well as for a future `estimatefeerate` RPC in sat/vB. The code changes are less than 40 lines. Most of the diff is test coverage, as these changes touch a number of RPCs.

Changes:

- add `CFeeRate::FromSatB` and `CFeeRate::FromBtcKb` named constructors
- add a `CFeeRate::IsZero()` class member helper to replace `== CFeeRate(0)` conditionals and avoid object allocations/constructions
- add a `FeeRateFromValueInSatB()` utility function that calls `AmountFromValue()` and then performs an additional check for non-representable `CFeeRate` values in the range between 0 and 0.001 sat/vB
- add unit and functional tests and fill some current fee rate gaps in the functional test coverage

comments.body: I see that we're no longer checking for smaller than zero. Are we just relying on that being invalid for a transaction in the first place?

Thanks for the quick review! AmountFromValue does raise on negative values in its MoneyRange check and we should already have tests for that. I'll double check. Edit: found test coverage improvements we can make.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -192,26 +192,27 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_approx(res1["fee"], 0.055, 0.005)
         res2 = self.nodes[1].walletcreatefundedpsbt(inputs, outputs, 0, {"feeRate": 0.1, "add_inputs": True})
         assert_approx(res2["fee"], 0.055, 0.005)
+
